00002  * jcom.pass
00003  * External for Jamoma: pass messages if they match our criteria

00010 #include "Jamoma.h"
00011 
00012 #define MAX_ARGCOUNT 100
00013 #define MAX_MESS_SIZE 2048
00014 
00015 typedef struct _pass{                                           // Data Structure for this object
00016         t_object        ob;                                                     // REQUIRED: Our object
00017         void            *obex;                                          // REQUIRED: Object Extensions used by Jitter/Attribute stuff 
00018         void            *outlets[MAX_ARGCOUNT];         // my outlet array
00019         void            *outlet_overflow;                       // this outlet doubles as the dumpout outlet
00020         t_atom          arguments[MAX_ARGCOUNT];
00021         short           num_args;
00022         long            attr_strip;                                     // ATTRIBUTE: 1 = strip leading slash off any messages
00023         long            attr_stripnonmatches;           // ATTRIBUTE: 1 = strip leading slash off overflow
00024 } t_pass;
00025 
00026 // Prototypes for our methods:
00027 void *pass_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00028 void pass_assist(t_pass *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst);
00029 void pass_int(t_pass *x, long n);
00030 void pass_float(t_pass *x, double f);
00031 void pass_symbol(t_pass *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00032 void pass_list(t_pass *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv);
00033 
00034 // Globals
00035 t_class         *pass_class;                            // Required: Global pointer for our class
00036 
00037 
00038 /************************************************************************************/
00039 // Main() Function
00040 
00041 int main(void)                          // main recieves a copy of the Max function macros table
00042 {
00043         long attrflags = 0;
00044         t_class *c;
00045         t_object *attr;
00046         
00047         jamoma_init();
00048 
00049         // Define our class
00050         c = class_new("jcom.pass",(method)pass_new, (method)0L, (short)sizeof(t_pass), (method)0L, A_GIMME, 0);
00051         class_obexoffset_set(c, calcoffset(t_pass, obex));
00052 
00053         // Make methods accessible for our class: 
00054         class_addmethod(c, (method)pass_int,                            "int",          A_DEFLONG,      0L);
00055         class_addmethod(c, (method)pass_float,                          "float",        A_DEFFLOAT,     0L);
00056         class_addmethod(c, (method)pass_list,                           "list",         A_GIMME, 0L);   
00057         class_addmethod(c, (method)pass_symbol,                         "anything", A_GIMME, 0L);       
00058         class_addmethod(c, (method)pass_assist,                         "assist",       A_CANT, 0L); 
00059     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_dumpout,     "dumpout",      A_CANT,0);  
00060     class_addmethod(c, (method)object_obex_quickref,    "quickref", A_CANT, 0);
00061 
00062         // ATTRIBUTE: strip
00063         attr = attr_offset_new("strip", _sym_long, attrflags,
00064                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_pass, attr_strip));
00065         class_addattr(c, attr); 
00066 
00067         // ATTRIBUTE: stripnonmatches
00068         attr = attr_offset_new("stripnonmatches", _sym_long, attrflags,
00069                 (method)0, (method)0, calcoffset(t_pass, attr_stripnonmatches));
00070         class_addattr(c, attr);
00071 
00072         // Finalize our class
00073         class_register(CLASS_BOX, c);
00074         pass_class = c;
00075         return 0;
00076 }
00077 
00078 
00079 /************************************************************************************/
00080 // Object Life
00081 
00082 void *pass_new(t_symbol *s, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00083 {
00084         short i;
00085         char argument[MAX_MESS_SIZE];   // temporary container for arguments
00086         t_pass  *x = (t_pass *)object_alloc(pass_class);
00087         long attrstart = attr_args_offset(argc, argv);
00088         
00089         if(x){
00090                 x->outlet_overflow = outlet_new(x, 0);          // overflow outlet
00091                 object_obex_store((void *)x, _sym_dumpout, (object *)x->outlet_overflow);       // dumpout
00092 //              x->num_args = argc;
00093                 x->num_args = attrstart;
00094 
00095                 for(i=x->num_args-1; i >= 0; i--){                              
00096                         x->outlets[i] = outlet_new(x, 0);               // Create Outlet
00097                         switch(argv[i].a_type){
00098                                 case A_LONG:
00099                                         atom_setlong(&(x->arguments[i]), atom_getlong(argv+i));
00100                                         break;
00101                                 case A_FLOAT:
00102                                         atom_setfloat(&(x->arguments[i]), atom_getfloat(argv+i));
00103                                         break;
00104                                 case A_SYM:
00105                                         strcpy(argument, atom_getsym(argv+i)->s_name);
00106                                         if(argument[0] == '/')
00107                                                 atom_setsym(&(x->arguments[i]), gensym(argument+1));
00108 //                                      else if(argument[0] == '@')             // This is the start of our attributes
00109 //                                              goto out;
00110                                         else
00111                                                 atom_setsym(&(x->arguments[i]), gensym(argument));
00112                                         break;
00113                         }
00114                 }
00115 //out:
00116                 x->attr_strip = 1;                                                      // set default
00117                 x->attr_stripnonmatches = 0;
00118                 attr_args_process(x, argc, argv);                       //handle attribute args 
00119         }
00120         return (x);                                                                             // return the pointer to our new instantiation
00121 }

00124 /************************************************************************************/
00125 // Methods bound to input/inlets
00126 
00127 // Method for Assistance Messages
00128 void pass_assist(t_pass *x, void *b, long msg, long arg, char *dst)
00129 {
00130         if(msg==1)                                              // Inlet
00131                 strcpy(dst, "Input");
00132         else if(msg==2){                                // Outlets
00133                 if(arg < x->num_args){
00134                         t_symbol        *argname;
00135                         char            tempstring[200];
00136                         switch(x->arguments[arg].a_type){
00137                                 case A_LONG:
00138                                         sprintf(tempstring, "%ld", atom_getlong(&x->arguments[arg]));
00139                                         strcpy(dst, tempstring);
00140                                         break;
00141                                 case A_FLOAT:
00142                                         sprintf(tempstring, "%f", atom_getfloat(&x->arguments[arg]));
00143                                         strcpy(dst, tempstring);
00144                                         break;
00145                                 case A_SYM:
00146                                         argname = atom_getsym(&x->arguments[arg]);
00147                                         strcpy(dst, argname->s_name);
00148                                         break;
00149                         }
00150                 }
00151                 else
00152                         strcpy(dst, "dumpout / overflow from non-matching input");      
00153         }               
00154 }
00155 
00156 
00157 // INT INPUT
00158 void pass_int(t_pass *x, long n)
00159 {
00160         short i;
00161         
00162         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00163                 if(x->arguments[i].a_type == A_LONG){
00164                         if(n == atom_getlong(&x->arguments[i])){
00165                                 outlet_int(x->outlets[i], n);
00166                                 return;
00167                         }
00168                 }
00169         }
00170         outlet_int(x->outlet_overflow, n);
00171 }
00172 
00173 
00174 // FLOAT INPUT
00175 void pass_float(t_pass *x, double f)
00176 {
00177         short i;
00178         
00179         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00180                 if(x->arguments[i].a_type == A_FLOAT){
00181                         if(f == atom_getfloat(&x->arguments[i])){
00182                                 outlet_float(x->outlets[i], f);
00183                                 return;
00184                         }
00185                 }
00186         }
00187         outlet_float(x->outlet_overflow, f);
00188 }
00189 
00190 
00191 // SYMBOL INPUT
00192 void pass_symbol(t_pass *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00193 {
00194         short           i;
00195         t_symbol        *message;
00196         char *input = msg->s_name;
00197 
00198         // strip any leading slashes
00199         if(*input == '/')
00200                 input++;
00201         message = gensym(input);
00202 
00203         // parse and send
00204         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00205                 if(message == atom_getsym(&x->arguments[i])){
00206                         if(x->attr_strip != 0)
00207                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[i], message, argc , argv);
00208                         else
00209                                 outlet_anything(x->outlets[i], msg, argc , argv);
00210                         return;
00211                 }
00212         }
00213         if(x->attr_stripnonmatches !=0)
00214                 outlet_anything(x->outlet_overflow, message, argc , argv);
00215         else
00216                 outlet_anything(x->outlet_overflow, msg, argc , argv);
00217 }
00218 
00219 
00220 // LIST INPUT
00221 void pass_list(t_pass *x, t_symbol *msg, long argc, t_atom *argv)
00222 {
00223         short           i;
00224         t_symbol        *message;
00225         
00226         // strip any leading slashes
00227         if(x->attr_strip != 0){
00228                 char *input = msg->s_name;
00229                 if(*input == '/')
00230                         input++;
00231                 message = gensym(input);
00232         }
00233                 
00234         // parse and send
00235         switch(argv[0].a_type){
00236                 case A_LONG:
00237                         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00238                                 if(x->arguments[i].a_type == A_LONG){
00239                                         if(atom_getlong(argv) == atom_getlong(&x->arguments[i])){
00240                                                 outlet_list(x->outlets[i], 0L, argc , argv);
00241                                                 return;
00242                                         }
00243                                 }
00244                         }
00245                         outlet_list(x->outlet_overflow, 0L, argc , argv);
00246                         break;
00247                 case A_FLOAT:
00248                         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00249                                 if(x->arguments[i].a_type == A_FLOAT){
00250                                         if(atom_getfloat(argv) == atom_getfloat(&x->arguments[i])){
00251                                                 outlet_list(x->outlets[i], 0L, argc , argv);
00252                                                 return;
00253                                         }
00254                                 }
00255                         }
00256                         outlet_list(x->outlet_overflow, 0L, argc , argv);
00257                         break;
00258                 case A_SYM:
00259                         for(i=0; i< x->num_args; i++){
00260                                 if(atom_getsym(argv) == atom_getsym(&x->arguments[i])){
00261                                         outlet_anything(x->outlets[i], message, argc , argv);
00262                                         return;
00263                                 }
00264                         }
00265                         outlet_list(x->outlet_overflow, 0L, argc , argv);
00266                         break;
00267                 default:
00268                         outlet_list(x->outlet_overflow, 0L, argc , argv);
00269                         break;
00270         }
00271 }
